channel.title: Monster Energy
channel.description: How many can you drink in 5 minutes? My record is like 2 or 3.

I think I was going through caffeine detox because I stopped drinking like 3 volteges a day and then I stopped drinking it for a week and I was sick the whole week, now I drink about half a bottle a day.

Also I am not fat, if you say I am.

item.title: Monster Energy
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:45, topic:320411”][quote author=runefreak10 link=topic=416889.msg3068606#msg3068606 date=1261375588]
Wth? How? How strong is a drop of caffeine? (Or whatever the form caffeine comes in)
[/quote]

My biology teacher told me this, so I just decided to research it quick.

Once you hit about 300mg(I have heard of different numbers for this) of caffeine, you may start to get something called ‘caffeine intoxication’. This is when you start to get extremely hyper, and it increases your heart rate irregularly, etc.

Once you get past 2g(I have heard of different numbers for this), your body will most likely overload from the energy and just start to shut down.

This site has information all about caffeine:
http://www.energyfiend.com

Death calculator(there was a thread on mitb about this if I remember):
http://www.energyfiend.com/death-by-caffeine[/quote]

2 grams is a lot more then a needle head though. It’s about half a teaspoon

Read full topic

item.title: Monster Energy
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Chassy13:

Why exactly is red bull so expensive? A monster here costs like $3.19 and a red bull is around $4.39.

And redbull is smaller, + there is less caffeine and all the other junk they put in it.

I used to buy boo-koo, because it had 80 grams of sugar and 360 mg’s of caffeine so it did a pretty good job of keeping you awake. Redbull only has 80 mg of caffeine. Now I hate the flavor of them all except for rockstar roasted mocha

Read full topic

item.title: Monster Energy
item.dc:creator: @T3arful T3arful
item.description:
@T3arful wrote:

Actually after reading up on Taurine a little bit the Taurine which is used in pharmaceuticals or the food industry doesn’t contain bull sperm or bull urine. It’s just an urban legend, although there is another type or Taurine that does contain Bull sperm/urine.

Read full topic

item.title: Monster Energy
item.dc:creator: @CAPT_AMERIKA AMERIKA
item.description:
@CAPT_AMERIKA wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:33, topic:320411”][quote author=T3arful link=topic=416889.msg3067374#msg3067374 date=1261321912]

Red Bull has bull sperm in it.

I hope that was a joke. Taurine in red bull isn’t really bull sperm. Taurine is produced by many mammals however in pharmacy and the food industry it is chemically synthesized.

Yes but what I am saying is somewhat true.
[/quote]

Not really. In no way was bull sperm used to make your redbull.

Just because taurine is found in sperm, does not make it somewhat true either. h20 is also found in semen. So just about everything you eat contains semen? No thats not true at all.[/quote]
my hero. brb getting redbull.

Read full topic
